Title: sysstat: Arbitrary code execution
Synopsis:
A use-after-free in sysstat was discovered which may allow
    arbitrary code execution.

Background.Text: sysstat is a package containing a number of performance monitoring utilities for Linux, including sar, mpstat, iostat and sa tools.

Description.Text: A double-free in sysstatâ€™s check_file_actlst() function was discovered.

Impact.Text: A local attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All sysstat users should upgrade to the latest version:
